net.adamcin.oakpal.api

Interface SilenceableCheck

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ProgressCheck, ScanListener, ViolationReporter

    @ConsumerType
public interface SilenceableCheck
extends ProgressCheck
    Extended interface marking progress checks that respect a mid-scan mode that expects oakpal to temporarily silence violations triggered by scan events. ProgressChecks that do not implement this interface are simply blocked from receiving scan events for the duration of the silent period.
    Since:
    2.2.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void setSilenced(boolean silenced)
      If silenced is true, this check must DISABLE the collection of violations until this method is called again with silenced=false.

      • Methods inherited from interface net.adamcin.oakpal.api.ProgressCheck

        afterExtract, afterScanPackage, appliedRepoInitScripts, beforeExtract, beforeSlingInstall, deletedPath, getCheckName, identifyEmbeddedPackage, identifyPackage, identifySubpackage, importedPath, importedPath, readManifest, simulateSling

      • Methods inherited from interface net.adamcin.oakpal.api.ScanListener

        finishedScan, startedScan

      • Methods inherited from interface net.adamcin.oakpal.api.ViolationReporter

        getReportedViolations, getResourceBundleBaseName, setResourceBundle

    • Method Detail

      • setSilenced

        void setSilenced(boolean silenced)
        If silenced is true, this check must DISABLE the collection of violations until this method is called again with silenced=false.
        Parameters:
        silenced - true to silence violation reporting
